website_summaries.verdict: The BenQ EX3501R is a 35-inch ultra-wide entertainment monitor that can beautifully render HDR content, and delivers good color and tip-top grayscale performance.
cons: Ports out of sight and hard to reach

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Horrible monitor, I'm a competitive gamer and the picture and colour are nice but the ghosting and motion blur are just horrific if you are playing a fps game and are doing anything other than running in a straight line forwards you have no chance of even seeing anybody let alone shooting them. It's enough to make me feel nauseous, I've come from a 27 inch tn panel to this and the gain in colour is just not worth the loss of fluidity
customer_reviews.author: System Repairs UK

customer_reviews.title: If buying for xbox one x ,this monitor will run it at full spec
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good 4k monitor especially for the price.I bought this for gaming on my xbox one x and it ticks all the boxes allowing me to play Gears of war ,halo ,codww2 and even fortnite in 4k HDR 60hz its perfect for the xbox one x and allows you to get everything out of the console . BENQ always seems to deliver in price and quality for that money. My only issue is the menu system takes abit to get use to but doesnt take too long but i do like that there is a HDR button
customer_reviews.author: stuart corbett

customer_reviews.title: Cheap 4k 28" HDR monitor
customer_reviews.text: If you're going to use the monitor in a close distance (about 50cm) avoid it if possible. I don't know why (probably because the panel is not that good) but if you look it at a normal height (around the 50~75% of the screen) it becomes darksih on the top (some kind of brown/dark-red) and excessively bright on the bottom. This is not that obvious when playing, but with a webpage is always there. I've also tested it with a game (Far Cry 5), and it shows a huge ghosting sometimes (something dark over a bright background).
customer_reviews.author: KPY

customer_reviews.title: Terrible banding in HDR mode
customer_reviews.text: A very nice looking monitor, however, beware if buying for HDR content. My monitor has suffered from terrible colour banding when set in HDR mode. Unfortunately, this makes the entire screen very unusable as scenes suffer "auras" around areas (see pic). When in non-HDR ("normal") mode, the banding goes away. This effect is the same on both HDMI and DisplayPort from multiple PCs. If this is the quality that BenQ strive for, I'll be careful with recommending them in future.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a console. 4k HDR at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Super monitor. Being used for my PS4 and the HDR works wonders for games like Horizon and God of War. The built in speakers are adequate for a bedroom set up but might need a boost for a living-room. This is a great 4k HDR monitor for the price and the second Benq monitor I own. For value for money you can't beat the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. Barker

customer_reviews.title: Superb 4k Gaming monitor..
customer_reviews.text: Bought this monitor for our family consoles, Ps4 Pro & Xbox one X look and run absolutely fantastic on this unit and for just over £200 it's a bargain.. But it's having to go back because it has a dead pixel, a red dot on screen which is a shame..Will rebuy another one once return been processed.. Have replaced for another unit and the replacement is perfect, no issues at all.. Excellent monitor.. Recommended..
customer_reviews.author: Jasbo72

customer_reviews.title: PS4 Gamer
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted to my standard PS4. Crisp graphics. Great colours. Definitely noticed a difference from an Acer 4K monitor I bought which I really didn't like the colours so returned. But this one is the bees knees. Speaker isn't the best but does the job when you need it. Then again its just an extra so can't complain. HDR seems to make a slight difference but until games support HDR, I don't think its completely necessary. Then again, when PS5 comes out, I guess I won't have to upgrade my monitor :)
customer_reviews.author: Usamah

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: At the moment, it is difficult to test at higher refresh rates due to restrictions of Xbox One X and a laptop which is limited with an Integrated GPU that has a max 60 Hz. Xbox one cannot push beyond 60 Hz, nor can I set the monitor at 1440p and 120Hz; only 1080p and 60 Hz or 4k, HDR (which is upscaled) at 60 Hz However, in the future, if I decide to buy a new Xbox or a gaming PC, I believe may just look great at 144 Hz. Cons: Blacks have already started appearing in different areas with grey patches, as read this is a problem with pixels
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Affordable gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up during the Black Friday sale for under £240. Given the features its an absolute steal. Haven't had chance to test out any 4k content, but HDR works perfectly on my xbox one S. For anyone reading reviews about 'fake HDR', this can be a little misleading. While other displays, typically TVs offer a greater brightness, this monitor does support true HDR, providing the device connected (in my case, an xbox one) also supports HDR. When HDR is enabled from the monitor and there is no HDR content to display, the monitor uses software to emulate the HDR experience. Speakers are serviceable, but I recommend using headphones or using external speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not true 4K
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the screen is just 4k but honestly my 1080p curved samsung moniter has better blacks, colour and quality, would only buy if you want a 1ms monitor and want quality that is in my eyes worse than a £120 1080p monitor, the colours were washed out on this monitor and the HDR function is a gimmick, Hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: newcastlerich

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Great quality monitor. HDR is good- it does adjust itself a little too often but is bright and very good at this price. There’s no discernible ghosting at all. No problem with latency either through Xbox or PC. Really enjoyed Warzone and RDR2. Sound is very good too but I have a big set of speakers. AND it has a e-reader mode= I really appreciate this extra which as far as I know is not found on other screens. Thanks BenQ!
customer_reviews.author: Jabbar

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase of the year
customer_reviews.text: Ok, first up, don't expect the best with this monitor. It was crazy cheap on prime day, cheaper than any 4K 28 inch monitor available today, but I'm very happy with it. Response times are decent. I got 60hz with a display port cable, it has some cool ambiant light features, and various modes which are easy to switch between, and HDR (not that my GPU has sadly), and also a HDR emulation mode which looks pretty good. My last monitor, also a BenQ on prime day, two years ago, was great and has been moved to a different room, and this is easily better, and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: S. Patel

customer_reviews.title: Not the best...
customer_reviews.text: I have to be honest, i am not a fan of this monitor... The HDR is not good at all and not worth sticking on but i am sort of comparing to a TV i have. There is also an issue with the monitor not switching from HDR to SDR when the source changes and to sort it you have to manually turn the HDR off. I would call the HDR a gimmick and would not recommend someone buying it for this. If you dont care for HDR then its a good mointor and works a treat! :)
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Nice but poor HDR
customer_reviews.text: This is my first 4k monitor. To me it looks great, nice and bright and it handles movement in games brilliantly. The HDR is a gimmick though, it really adds nothing and when playing PS4 games it's barely noticeable. If you've used a 4k screen before and just want a replacement I wouldn't recommend this, but if it's your first 4k monitor and you are on a budget you won't be disappointed. I wasn't.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Michael B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: 4k hdr console gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great Monitor does what its says on the tin. 4k and hdr running at 60 hertz great for console gaming clear and detailed image had it over a week and it's been great. Hdr auto applies to games that use hdr and you can emulate on games that dont to have hdr. Bi is a great feature so if you have long gaming sessions you wont ruin your eyes with this monitor. A great monitor if you want your blacks to be black and not washed out, for me a great buy
customer_reviews.author: The kappa convict

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic 4k monitor with freesync but not so much on hdr.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for xbox one x. Played pubg on my 55 inch suhd but always had trouble looking for enemies from a far. Tried the benq monitor as i was curious what it would be like using one. The screen is way smaller from the 55 inch tv but I can see all the details and the enemies from a far. I tried to turn of the hdr for pubg as it is washed out. Pubg has not fixed the problem. But on other games it's ok with hdr. But the details are far better with 4k and freesync turned on even if I'm colour blind. The response time too is superior. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: kevomc

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly happy
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a 4k screen for office use. This one was on budget. Works perfectly well, great picture quality, the max resolution was detected and no config was necessary. A few minor quibbles - the speakers are terrible, for this price that was expected anyway though and I never intended to use them. Regarding viewing angle, there isn't really much range, but if you're just sat directly in front of the screen you should find it is fine. Last thing is the stand, the screen can be tilted but not raised and lowered, might be a big deal to some people but I'm ok with the height.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B. Stokes

customer_reviews.title: No DP cable? Really?
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is awesome. It's my first curved monitor, so I have to get used to it. But really guys? What the eff should I do with a MINI DISPLAYPORT CABLE? The package does not have a proper DP cable, only hdmi. You don't use hdmi to a freesync/g-sync monitor guys, unless you play casual things like FIFA, COD, Overwatch, or Rocket League on your PC. In which case why don't you buy a console? Come on BenQ, it's 2019, hdmi is for TVs, not for gaming monitors!
customer_reviews.author: dONALD

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great value monitor for gaming, able to get the most out of my xbox by playing in 4K, 1ms delay is great for first person shooters, and monitor size is perfect for a desktop gaming setup. Sometimes when in HDR mode the display goes funny, as seen in the pictures attached, which is a little off for a monitor worth a couple of hundred pounds. However a quick restart fixes the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: No pixel issues, easy to use. simple for PC and Xbox
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a no frills UHD HDR monitor. This is an excellent one. minimal menu. Wish quick functions on the buttons were for audio, rather than blue filter or HDR on/off. Good build.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G. M. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a new monitor and working from home gave me the incentive to purchase. Ultrawide gives you the flexibility to open multiple windows on one monitor. Also excellent for gaming, space restrictions meant that my 3 monitor setup for sim racing had to go and be replaced with this, not quite as immersive but a great compromise. This is an excellent monitor, nice crisp display and able to accept three different inputs if required,.
customer_reviews.author: Paul V

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Firstly I didn't buy this for gaming, though I do know it's mainly a gaming monitor, but after reading many reviews from video editors I decided to give it a try for my photo & video editing work Have to say I'm not disappointed, it is a superb monitor. Colours are great and I love the size plus the slight curve just makes it so easy to view. Very happy! :)
customer_reviews.author: J. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use on Xbox One X and I must say it's excellent. Very crisp and vibrant colours. Speakers are good, but as you'd expect they are not the main focus for a gaming monitor as most users will have external speakers or headset. To summarise Pros: Crisp picture quality Decent speakers Cons: Operating the menu only via buttons on the monitor Blacks appear a bit blotchy at times
customer_reviews.author: CallumJ9

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bought this monitor as a second screen for my consoles, as never get chance to play on the big screen, size is perfect and the picture is clear and sharp only criticism is I wish the colours where a bit more vibrant compared to my Samsung TV, the speakers are good some reviews say they arnt the best but they are loud and clear just lack base, my ps4 pro looks great and games play amazing on it
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming monitor. Awful built in speakers
customer_reviews.text: Brought for use with the xbox one x as that runs hdr. picture quality is fantastic and nice and easy to set up. If I had one quibble the built in speakers are awful even at full blast they are very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for money
customer_reviews.text: I bought the BenQ as a 2nd monitor for my work laptop (Windows 10) and also as a 2nd screen when using Lightroom/Photoshop on my Mac. The colours, brightness and contrast are excellent. The build quality is good but the push button menus are cumbersome but then I don't use them all that often. It would be handy if it was supplied with a remote to overcome this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nugent

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant image quality, easy to set up, just plug in and go. Particularly like the USB hub built in so that I can leave everything plugged into the Monitor when I unplug the laptop and it is basically a docking station too. Ohh and it's HUGE. Lots of screen space for my spreadsheets, letters and emails all at the same time. I've basically stopped printing anything off to refer to now as I can have it all open at the same time side by side on the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Comfy camper

customer_reviews.title: Dont see any HDR benefits, swivel very limited
customer_reviews.text: Bought this little monitor to replace my 40", 6 year old 1080p tv and honestly when im playing videogames and watching movies the quality is exactly the same even though my bliray player upscales to 4k video... and the main thing is the colours on this 4k monitor with "HDR" is that the colours are actually WORSE than the ones on my old tv.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for extending screen space
customer_reviews.text: We are using this monitor to transform a laptop into a workstation while working from home. It was simple to set up, and provides a lot of extra screen space, for the best price in its class. I like the curved format - it is much more elegant than a dual monitor configuration, while nearly as wide. Also, it's good that it has a VESA mount in case we ever want to use it on a different stand.
customer_reviews.author: Vauxhall Hoosier

customer_reviews.title: Two Monitors same Problem.
customer_reviews.text: This was my Second time trying this monitor the first one i bought in June 2018 had really bad Flickering on Dark or Grey images so i sent it back for a refund. So fast forward a few months to Now November 2018 i decided to try this monitor again but this one had the Same problem Flickering on Dark or Grey images it’s a nice 4K screen just the Flickering is really annoying and the BenQ Customer support is terrible will never buy BenQ again.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Not even  4k
customer_reviews.text: Was using this with a ps4 pro. took me exactly 15 minutes of using it before returning it. the picture quality doesn't even match that of my old monitor that I have had for 4 years. The built in speakers are muffled,the colours look worn out and just not a good experience overall. Not to mention this is the second one that had to be ordered since the first one got broke in transit after an our of leaving the warehouse.Then was guaranteed next day delivery and was still 2 days late after that. safe to say not buying this monitor again.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Ellis-Missin

customer_reviews.title: Monitor came with dead pixels.
customer_reviews.text: Not one to write reviews but unfortunately I feel like I have to warn people this time. Saw this monitor as I was in search for an upgraded monitor for my work station and the BenQ EL2870U seemed like a good fit. I was excited to get it set up but my excitement was cut short when I realized there were dead green pixels on the screen that were small but extremely visible under all conditions. I'm sure that not all monitors have this issue but it is something to look out for if you are choosing this one though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome monitor
customer_reviews.text: Awesome monitor looks the part and the picture quality is great, if there was two tiny niggles one is the buttons underneath could be better positioned and the other thing is the cover on the back to hide the connections to the monitor one side keeps popping out which annoys me but probably wouldn't effect anyone else as it's round the back. But I would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Spags

customer_reviews.title: Defective monitor broken after 30 mins, nearly roasted my GPU
customer_reviews.text: After 30 mins of use, HDR button ceased to function properly and the display went green (see picture). Even when it was working, colours were washed out & refresh rate is pretty bad for a £250 monitor. Yeah, just don't bother. Gotta take time out of my day to lug this badboy to the nearest Hermes collection for a return. Just a waste of time and space, really.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt output 144Hz at 2k
customer_reviews.text: ive had this monitor for 10 months and ive only now realised after upgrading my graphics card that this monitor doesn't run at 144Hz at full resolution like its states on the listing. the most it can run is 120Hz at full resolution, and that was with my old card. my new card can only run 60Hz at 2k (the card in question is Radeon Rx5700 xt) . if you have a pc and want this as your monitor look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Mister gunna buy yo stuff

customer_reviews.title: It’s 4K at its worst
customer_reviews.text: This IS a 4K monitor, just a poor one. It does show a 3840x2160p resolution, but the colour accuracy and virtually everything else is way off. The ‘HDR’ functionality is awful to be polite. It’s like having a sepia filter on; the contrast is turned down and saturation way up. The colours look washed out. Simply put, spend a bit more and get hdr 10. It has a 60hz (60fps) refresh rate, which would be great were it not for the amount of screen noise. After an hour playing an FPS or Fifa, I fealt sick. It just becomes a blurred mess. In summary, don’t be attracted by the low price point. Save up, splash out and get something nice.
customer_reviews.author: Kieran F.

customer_reviews.title: Good value 4k monitor but forget about the HDR
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this monitor for a little while now and am overall satisfied with this purchase. I've been using this as my secondary monitor to do some light productivity work and also play games in 4k. However, the HDR on this monitor is terrible and not worth using as it makes the colours look so washed out. I have the monitor set to Photo mode with HDR and BI+ turned off and the screen is bright and vibrant.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I use an ultra wide monitor and it is a step up! Just want to mention three things that will make this monitor an amazing performer 1. Create a custom resolution with 99Hz instead of default 100Hz 2 .Change the resolution to the custom one created 3. Set AMA to Premium after you have done steps 1 and 2 You can test the difference using a ufo motion test, just google it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded all expectations
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor! It has good functionality as well as quality. The HDR10 that in some reviews wasn't so great turned out to work perfectly on a nvidia card. The speakers are adequate for general use. All in all im not sure i could have got a better monitor. Slight contrast issue out of the box but corrected with small fiddle of settings.
customer_reviews.author: Conner mcleod

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Monitor, Disappointing HDR
customer_reviews.text: An average high-spec monitor at a great price. The 32" 1440p display is crisp, colourful and looks good regardless of what you throw at it. The size is a little overwhelming at first if you're not used to it, but it's worth getting used to, especially for streaming video content. High refresh and FreeSync 2 both perform as expected and have definitely improved my experience with a few FPS titles (e.g. Destiny 2). My only warning is don't buy this monitor if the main feature you're looking for is HDR. The difference between normal and HDR colour modes is underwhelming compared to similarly priced HDR-focused displays.
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't work on Macbook :(
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this monitor as another display for my Macbook; however, the only setting I could get the monitor to show up on was 1024px wide which is like I'm back in 2000. No other resolutions and/or refresh rates via HDMI or DVI would work on this monitor - just doesn't seem to play well with Macbooks unfortunately :(
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: HDR confusing only works on some games .
customer_reviews.text: Started using this monitor on the internet YouTube etc amazing quality no problems however when i used my Xbox one x i noticed that with fifa 19 the colors were washed out and almost unwatchable so i had to turn off the HDR for fifa and use game mode , however when i played battlefield 5 with HDR on the quality of picture was amazing so it would seem that the HDR only suits some games not all even though they claim to be HDR compatible .
customer_reviews.author: R Baker

customer_reviews.title: Superb dipslay.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to allow me to work from home during the Covid-19 lockdown. For that it does a great job. Where is really shines is streaming hd video or playing a Blu-Ray. The picture quality is fanatistic even upscaling Full HD to 4K. I am really impressed with it especially as it was keenly priced.
customer_reviews.author: L J Bond

customer_reviews.title: if you're looking for ultrawide, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Monitor is generally well built however connections ports are tempormental and akward to get to, cables stick out beneath the monitor and there is no chance getting the cover to fit over the mess. Usb ports will not supply power to other devices unless the monitor is connected via usb C. Although the bezel is only 2mm thick, the screen will not display to the edge so you are left with a 10mm edge which cannot be used as part of the display. colours are not that impressive and often look washed out, motion blur is an issue when gaming. not worth the pricetag.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Top monitor
customer_reviews.text: Overall very happy with this monitor (bought during black Friday ~£330). Great image quality, bright colours, decent blacks, responsive. My only gripe is slight backlight bleed around the edges although this isn't much of an issue for me since you can only really see it when it display a blank dark image.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T. L. Chan

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was initially very excited with the reviews I had read about this screen. However the reality didn't match my expectations at all. Despite the screen being curved, the viewing angles are sadly very poor, resulting in degraded image quality (brightness, contrast and color) on both sides of the screen; only about a third of the screen is adequate... I have now returned it.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor if you have an Xbox One X
customer_reviews.text: Can't speak for PS4 or PC owners but if you have an Xbox One X for the price this is a good monitor. Seems it was made for the Xbox One X what with the HDR10 compatibility and 4K. Internal speakers aren't much but I just brought a reasonably priced pair of PC speakers. The picture quality will blow you away.
customer_reviews.author: Robbo

customer_reviews.title: Not good for videos
customer_reviews.text: The only good thing about this monitor is that it is easy to set up. However, I can't use this monitor because the video playing is horrible - videos play smoothly on my laptop, but stop and play every few seconds on the monitor. I can't watch and enjoy videos. The snapshot is also not good - when doing a snapshot in the monitor, it is never a full screen pasted. In addition, the monitor is not adjustable so it made my neck ache after some time. The size is also big for my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Major ghosting
customer_reviews.text: This monitor has major ghosting issues. I've tried multiple inputs, but each causes horrible artifacts when moving anything on the screen, especially anything dark.
customer_reviews.author: TAyling92

customer_reviews.title: Ben Q 2870u
customer_reviews.text: I have found this monitor to be an excellent all-round performer. The picture settings are as they came out the box with no reason to adjust. The only thing I change are the picture modes to suit my activity. Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R. Shedden

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good monitor with excellent picture clarity, they only thing that disappoints is the speaker quality which is subpar. The motion-flow is fantastic, very smooth thus pulling one into the action. One can always add a soundbar like I did, this will then cover for the lack of high sound coming from the on-board speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby.

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor. Poor speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor for the price. The sound isn’t very good. Severely lacking in any base. But if you’re gaming you’ll have a sound card. Also, If you’re using the hdmi connection then you can plug your earphones into the back of the monitor for better sound.
customer_reviews.author: Al G

customer_reviews.title: Bad image quality, banding, light bleeding...
customer_reviews.text: In my first product, there were problems on the screen (Vertical Banding & Light Bleeding and Dirty Screen). Especially in the lower left corner of the screen. I wanted to exchange products on it. In addition to the same problems in the new product, there were some scratches on the back side. The display image quality is not satisfactory at all. I don't recommend people who especially care about image quality. In spite of my warnings, Amazon has sent the new product unprotected. These situations may occur during the cargo process, be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Can Kaya

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor (Xbox1X
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Xbox 1X Really great monitor response time is noticeable compared to playing on a tv, overall value for money its very good! The only downside is the colours are not as vivid as I personally would like but after a while you adapt to it, the only way you would get this type of quality monitor and vivid colours would be to add another 250/300 on the price! Its a great monitor!
customer_reviews.author: John Moth

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to replace another 4k monitor I bought that was 1/3 more expensive
customer_reviews.text: Couldnt see where the extra money was. This is great, works well, Blue light filter helps my eyes I think. Only slight issue with it is that it detects input and moves to that display, Its both handy and annoying as my ps4 was booting up and kept not sending signal, meaning my monitor would go back over to my pc. But honestly, A small small moan. Well worth it
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Large screen area with resolution to match
customer_reviews.text: This sits in the middle of the price range for 3440x1440 resolution monitors and has a feature set to match. The display I received has no dead pixels at all and works very well for the somewhat undemanding games I play. I use a RTX 2060 for output and I've yet to see any significant slowdowns.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. M. Ladle

customer_reviews.title: Nice Screen but not adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Really nice screen and resolution! The only negative thing is that it is not adjustable. To make it higher for tall people, you need and monitor arm or to add couple of sturdy books!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Nakhoul

customer_reviews.title: Great sim racing monitor
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, no missing pixels on the screen, great colours
customer_reviews.author: Gary Neville

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant monitor well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a brilliant monitor i brought this for my xbox one x and the picture is absolutely brilliant ill upload a picture at a later date but i was really impressed by this monitor the monitor even senses when the hdr can proform and turns it on which save having to turn it on all the time the only bad thing you could say is maybe if came with remote might be abit easier to control but wasn't very hard to figure out what was what all in all great pice of kit well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Comparatively inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Occasional gaming but mainly video and TV viewing. Once set up it gives excellent definition and depth. The screen defaults to eyecare but once changed to the HDR emulation it is surprisingly good.
customer_reviews.author: M. G. Lever

customer_reviews.title: BenQ EL2870U 28" UHD 4K Monitor
customer_reviews.text: when I received this I wasn't sure if it would better my previous Samsung one, but it did with flying colours the setup was very easy and my games look stunning, so very pleased with this. Also thank you for a very speedy delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Nice monitor, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Nice monitor, easy to set up, nice size display, the resolution is good and have had no issues, goes into standby when i turn off my PC and not had to change any settings so a good display and it didn't break the bank
customer_reviews.author: GlennBo

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance
customer_reviews.text: When you turn on game it ghosts like mad. You see it as if the colour of an object gets split into all of the rainbow as it struggles to keep up with the movement. It has good refresh rates but it struggles with movement. Fifa was almost unplayable.
customer_reviews.author: Onetwoseventeen

customer_reviews.title: Avoid, it has issues
customer_reviews.text: The monitor has a persistent very rapid almost subliminal flicker. Causes headaches for me within seconds. Sitting right next to my other, working, monitor it's very very obvious. You should read the other reviews from unsatisfied customers and avoid this brand. It seems they're consistently low quality hardware.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Distinctly satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected given the price (on black friday) relative to other 4k screens. 60hz limit is not ideal for gaming but realistically one would need a hella decent graphics card to run modern games at higher fps in 4k. Good for desktop applications where colour accuracy isn't important.
customer_reviews.author: Aids

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor if your on a budget.
customer_reviews.text: Good Product for the price, sound quality isn't the best but I play using headphones in so not a massive issue, most games the screen qualiry looks amazing ( apex , battlefield etc ) how ever I did start playing NFS Heat and the black colours were very pixilated but that may be down to the console or the game itself. overall I would recommend this monitor to someone on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: JsyMez1k

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for everything I need, movies?and gaming. If you play with setting then you can get perfect picture whatever you're watching. I would have loved to give 5 stars but the tinny speakers and lack of remote control are a bit too much to ignore.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: 28” 4K monitor with HDR. great value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my PS4 to the pro so thought I’d better get a 4K monitor and this is a great gaming monitor and has hdr as well which really makes the colours pop and all at a reasonable price. The speakers on the monitor are ok but I use a my headset so wasn’t a problem for me. Overall this is a great monitor and at its price is well worth the money for the spec you get.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you are fussy about picture quality for gaming
customer_reviews.text: After playing about with the user settings for a good few hour I finally managed to get the screen suitable for gaming, the HDR is pointless, managed to get a better picture without it. And noticed a dead pixel just 2 days after delivery. Other than that the OSD is easy to use, volume isnt bad and the response time is great.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor 2020!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic monitor. I’ve always had high spec monitors before this one but I’ve never had a BenQ monitor until this one. I don’t think il ever use another brand apart from BenQ
customer_reviews.author: Reece

customer_reviews.title: Entry level price great gaming 4k hdr gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Very nice monitor for gaming! Not so much for movies. You can see the black large pixels on movies however not a deal breaker. I bought this monitor for gaming and i am very happy with the gaming experience. For entry level price you get 4k hdr gaming! Recommend
customer_reviews.author: mr b.

customer_reviews.title: Nice monitor
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely solid monitor, but speakers are very poor. Still, I'm buying wireless bluetooth headphones that I will pair to the laptop and listen through that. It's worth it although I would have preferred more flexibility in tilting and moving the monitor around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for gsming
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this monitor for a few months now and I have to say it's fantastic all round. It is solidly built and the screen is excellent. There are many options to tweak the screen to your liking and for gaming it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Baz

customer_reviews.title: I WAS GOING TO SEND IT BACK!!
customer_reviews.text: So, long story short. It was awful, cloudy dull screen. HDR is a flop (still is unfortunately). I was so disappointed after swapping this for my 4k TV. However (if gaming) PLEASE, initiate PC RGB settings in the consoles Video settings (also it may set it back to 1080p, so make sure to revert this). For those who are not using console and just for daily use there is a PC RGB setting in the monitors setting itself. Dont even mother with HDR, great monitor overall, was literally about to return it.
customer_reviews.author: karencrowhurst

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy for PS4 Pro
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor and actually had to return it as the quality was incredibly poor. On the PlayStation Pro the picture was washed and often blurry. This could be down to the hardware in the PlayStation of course also but the monitor did not do it any justice. This is a budget 4k monitor and you can definitely tell.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Dubell

customer_reviews.title: Everything I expected from the reviews
customer_reviews.text: My first hi-definition monitor, it's great. Onboard sound is good enough for my purposes, operating system and games display just fine, scaling is handled well. I've no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Family East

customer_reviews.title: NOT compatible with VESA mounting
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT compatible with the industry standard VESA mount unless you buy an adapter from BenQ themselves. The adapter seems to be permanently out of stock. This monitor continues to underwhelm at every opportunity.
customer_reviews.author: Asher Aghababa

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, great for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for gaming, mine showed up on time and in perfect condition, plugged in, good quality for price and a tiny bit reduced brightness. however it's eye care so does what it says basicaly, thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great image quality
customer_reviews.text: The monitor itself looks well made, and when switched on the picture is great. I am using this to play both PS4 and Switch on, and to work from home with. The picture quality is great in all those scenarios and it’s nice to be able to develop on such a large screen.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Beech

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, much prefer this to the Samsung one. the extra inch is noticeable. Wish it came with usb 3 instead of usb c cable tho. the Mini DP to DP cable is a greta should for my Mac Pro 6,1 tho.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap gaming game monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Good monitor. I have bought two for working at home and occasional PS4 play. Monitors are really good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Demon_dave

customer_reviews.title: Photo work not good games ok
customer_reviews.text: Had faulty spots in the screen no good for fine photography work ok games as moving screens on games you would not see the problem no setting to international std for photo temps etc
customer_reviews.author: michael ranger

customer_reviews.title: Vesa Mount not included
customer_reviews.text: It does not include Vesa Mount, even though it says that it supports it. You have to buy it separately. This was not mentioned in product description
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Petravicius

customer_reviews.title: Plain to see?
customer_reviews.text: Nice size screen but when playing in HRD the picture is dark. Now whether or it’s a setting thing I don’t know yet. Every other aspect is fine
customer_reviews.author: schroder01

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor
customer_reviews.text: Excellent monitor with a sharp picture and intuitive controls for adjusting the picture. Speakers aren't the best but perfectly fine for background music, video calls, etc. Base is solid and sturdy, if a little tricky to assemble alone given the screen's size. Excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Bosworth

customer_reviews.title: Great 4K monitor below £300!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic monitor! Well packaged and turned up with no defects. So far the picture quality is really good for the price and for gaming it's a great monitor. It is a TN Panel display so you are not going to get colours as vivid as you would on a IPS display. If your looking for a good 4K gaming monitor below £300 then this is without a doubt the one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Hodgson

customer_reviews.title: FALSE ADVERTISING THERE ARE NO SPEAKERS!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this specifically as it stated speakers an read the Q&A and the manufacturer even says it has 2 x 2W speakers BUT no speakers on the EL287OU only on the EW27 or the EW32 models
customer_reviews.author: IeuWms

customer_reviews.title: Fab
customer_reviews.text: This screen is a game changer! Brilliant for my new Xbox one X
customer_reviews.author: JALLY

customer_reviews.title: Cant go wrong
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor for pc with a Vega 64, used in combination with a xbox one which shows as a 4k display, also usb c connectivity did have a issue with the first monitor having dead pixels but this was quickly resolved by amazon
customer_reviews.author: MR MICHAEL K POOLMAN

customer_reviews.title: Buy this monitor
customer_reviews.text: If you have used inferior monitors for gaming in the past, this will be a very welcome change. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: "enigma_park"

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Husband bought this in the Black Friday deals, says it’s great. Perfect size for Xbox gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Crezza

customer_reviews.title: great monitor
customer_reviews.text: a good sound clear picture and well made plus a remote win-win
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great value and great monitora
customer_reviews.text: Really great monitors. I got two and they work brilliantly.
customer_reviews.author: IOW Guy

customer_reviews.title: Exceedingly overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: The worst back-light bleed I've ever seen on a monitor, it makes the already weak HDR redundant.
customer_reviews.author: C Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality screen
customer_reviews.text: I paid an incredibly low price for this very high quality screen. Why pay more.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: OK for what it does.
customer_reviews.text: It does what I want it to, which is to provide a big desktop for multiple windows open at the same time. Although the picture is reasonable I wouldn't use it for image work, as the brightness isn't uniform, and the gamut isn't very wide. I don't do gaming so cannot comment on its suitability.
customer_reviews.author: DaveS

customer_reviews.title: Complete trash, terrible screen smearing and motion blur.
customer_reviews.text: Complete trash, terrible screen smearing and motion blur. An absolute waste of time...returning for a refund
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great screen for gaming and photo editing.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dobson

customer_reviews.title: Stunning picture.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing picture. Only downside is the angles aren’t the best if you place the monitor to high on a desk the image is dark.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd-Rhys

customer_reviews.title: Great screen but disappointing sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Loving the quality of the image and accessibility to the function but the sound quality out of the HDMI is quite disappointing. Since it seems complicated to get HDMI sound equaliser online, I have solved my issue connecting speakers to the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: philippe

product_meta.title: BenQ EX3501R 35 Inch Ultra WQHD 100 Hz HDR Curved Gaming Monitor for Sim Racing, 21:9, 3440 x 1440, 1800R, FreeSync 2, B.I. Plus Sensor, HDMI, Display Port, USB-C - Black/Silver
product_meta.description:
Size Name:35 Inch (Ultra Wide QHD)| Style Name:Curved/100Hz/FreeSync/HDR/ HDMI/DP| Pattern Name:SinglePurpose built for extreme video enjoyment, EX3501R envelopes you in its radically curved 21:9 ultrawide 35 Inches screen with flawless performance for movies, videos and gaming. Featuring enhanced HDR technology, one-cable USB-C connectivity and environment-adaptive Brightness Intelligence Plus technology, EX3501R delivers wondrous personal entertainment. Monitor is VESA Wall Mountable (VESA mount not included in the box, available separately).

LEGAL DISCLAIMER
Product is sourced and shipped from the European Economic Area (EEA). Product is genuine original from manufacturer authorized distributors.

BOX CONTAINS
Monitor
Power cord for adapter (1.8m)
HDMI 2.0 cable(1.8m)
DP to mDP cable(1.8m)
USB Type-C cable (1m)‎

See more
feature_bullets: Panoramic entertainment: Immerse you in 35 Inch screen and 3440x1440 resolution with 1800R curvature
High dynamic range: EX3501R's HDR technology offers high brightness and contrast level and brings detailed image performance
USB-C one-cable connectivity: USB-C enables SuperSpeed USB data transfer and 2K video delivery over a single cable. Height adjustment (mm): 60mm
Ergonomic viewing comfort: Height, tilt adjustments and Brightness Intelligence Plus technology provide high viewing comfort
AMD FreeSync: AMD FreeSync empowers intensely smooth gameplay with eliminating choppy tearing and broken frames
